DOC.brief_summary: evaluate efficacy safety IV administration potassium chloride ( KCl ) plus 0.9 % NaCl compare KCl plus half-strength normal saline solution ( 0.45 % NaCl ) correct hypokalemia
DOC.brief_title: Efficacy KCl Plus 0.9 % NaCl Compare With KCl Plus 0.45 % NaCl
DOC.detailed_description: Hypokalemia frequently encounter hospitalized patient . Intravenous ( IV ) potassium repletion saline prefer used initial therapy . However , administration normal saline ( 0.9 % NaCl ) usually provoke sodium potassium diuresis , thus , might delay reversal hypokalemia . Object study : evaluate efficacy safety IV administration potassium chloride ( KCl ) plus 0.9 % NaCl compare KCl plus half-strength normal saline solution ( 0.45 % NaCl ) correct hypokalemia .
DOC.criteria: Serum K+ 2.53.49 mmol/L No life threaten condition hypokalemia Pregnancy Volume overload , heart failure Hypotension Acute kidney injury Dysnatremia K+ shift Salt waste nephropathy
